block.p: Ilene Tamar Schneier, a daughter of Leah and Alan Schneier of Short Hills, N.J., was married last evening to Nicholas Alexander Rieser, a son of Susan and Richard Rieser Jr. of Northbrook, Ill. Rabbi William Kraus officiated at the St. Regis Hotel in New York, and Cantor Elizabeth Goldmann participated in the ceremony.

Mrs. Rieser, 28, is an associate in the real estate group of Kaye Scholer, the New York law firm. She graduated cum laude from the University of Pennsylvania and received a law degree at Northwestern.

Ilene Tamar Schneier, a daughter of Leah and Alan Schneier of Short Hills, N.J., was married last evening to Nicholas Alexander Rieser, a son of Susan and Richard Rieser Jr. of Northbrook, Ill. Rabbi William Kraus officiated at the St. Regis Hotel in New York, and Cantor Elizabeth Goldmann participated in the ceremony.

Ilene Tamar Schneier, a daughter of Leah and Alan Schneier of Short Hills, N.J., was married last evening to Nicholas Alexander Rieser, a son of Susan and Richard Rieser Jr. of Northbrook, Ill. Rabbi William Kraus officiated at the St. Regis Hotel in New York, and Cantor Elizabeth Goldmann participated in the ceremony.

Mrs. Rieser, 28, is an associate in the real estate group of Kaye Scholer, the New York law firm. She graduated cum laude from the University of Pennsylvania and received a law degree at Northwestern.
Her father, a lawyer, is the global managing partner for tax and legal services at Deloitte & Touche, the accounting and consulting business in New York.
Mr. Rieser, also 28, works in New York as an associate at Friedman Billings Ramsey, an investment bank in Arlington, Va. He graduated cum laude from Amherst.
His father is a vice chairman, an executive vice president and the chief marketing and legal strategist at MB Financial, a Chicago holding company that owns several banks.
